Larry Page speaking to the European Parliament, 2009. An`` unexpected shakeup'' went down at Google today. Larry Page, company co-founder, will take over as CEO effective April 4. Page, 37, is reclaiming the top job from Eric Schmidt , who had been brought in as CEO a decade ago because Google's investors believed the company needed a more mature leader, reports KTVU.`` Eric Schmidt , 55, will remain an adviser to Page and Google's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , as Google's executive chairman.'' In my clear opinion, Larry is ready to lead and I'm excited about working with both him and Sergey Brin for a long time to come, he said in the statement.
